metadata.titleEn: Reasonable livestock carrying capacity estimation product of grassland in Qinghai-Tibet Plateau (2000-2019)
metadata.description: Reasonable carrying capacity, also known as theoretical carrying capacity, refers to the maximum number of domestic animals that can be carried by a certain grassland area in a certain period of time under the premise of moderate grazing (or mowing) and maintaining sustainable production of grassland to meet the needs of normal growth, reproduction and production of livestock. Based on the MODIS inversion data of forage yield (fresh weight, kg / hm2), the reasonable carrying capacity of grassland (sheep unit, mu / km2) was evaluated according to the code for calculation of grassland carrying capacity and grass livestock balance (DB 51 / t1480-2012) and calculation of reasonable carrying capacity of natural grassland (NY / T 635-2015), The time series is 2000-2019, and the spatial resolution is 250m. This data set can analyze the temporal and spatial variation characteristics of the theoretical carrying capacity under the condition of rational utilization of grassland in the Qinghai Tibet Plateau, evaluate the carrying capacity characteristics of grassland in the Qinghai Tibet Plateau, and extract the overgrazing areas, which has important application value for ecological protection, monitoring and early warning of the Qinghai Tibet Plateau.
metadata.instructions: QZGY_ CC_ 2000. Img, qzgy denotes the Qinghai Tibet Plateau, CC (carry capacity) denotes the reasonable carrying capacity, and the number 2000 denotes the year. The example shows the reasonable carrying capacity of the Qinghai Tibet Plateau in 2000. The data format is. Img format, and the data reading method is ArcGIS. The unit is sheep unit / square kilometer. It represents the carrying capacity of sheep per square meter.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key features and specifications of data collection methods used to estimate the reasonable livestock carrying capacity on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau from 2000 to 2019?
Feature Specification.Answer: MODIS satellite data, forage yield in fresh weight (kg/hm2), Grassland Carrying Capacity and Grass-Livestock Balance Calculation Specification (DB 51/T1480—2012), Calculation of Natural Grassland Reasonable Carrying Capacity (NY/T 635—2015), reasonable carrying capacity in sheep units (MU/km2), time series from 2000 to 2019, spatial resolution of 250 meters

Definition.Question: What does 'reasonable livestock carrying capacity' mean in the context of pasture management on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Definition.Answer: Reasonable livestock carrying capacity, also known as theoretical carrying capacity, refers to the maximum number of livestock that can be supported by a certain area of grassland within a specific time period, under conditions of moderate grazing or mowing that maintain the sustainable productivity of the grassland. This concept helps to meet the normal growth, reproduction, and production needs of livestock, ensuring sustainable use of grassland resources.

Interpretation.Question: What can the temporal patterns in reasonable livestock carrying capacity data from 2000 to 2019 suggest about the sustainability and management practices of grasslands on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Interpretation.Answer: The temporal patterns in reasonable livestock carrying capacity data from 2000 to 2019 can indicate changes in the sustainability and management practices of grasslands on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. These patterns, derived from MODIS-based estimations of edible forage yield, reflect the grassland's ability to support livestock under sustainable grazing conditions. By analyzing these patterns, researchers can identify trends in grassland utilization, assess grassland carrying characteristics, and detect regions subject to overgrazing. Such insights are crucial for ecological protection, monitoring, and early warning systems on the plateau.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are used to evaluate and determine the optimal livestock carrying capacity on grasslands utilizing MODIS-derived forage yield data?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The evaluation of optimal livestock carrying capacity on grasslands is conducted by utilizing forage yield data derived from MODIS. The procedures involve assessing the edible forage production in terms of fresh weight (kg/hm2) and applying the guidelines from 'The Grassland Carrying Capacity and Grass-Livestock Balance Calculation Standard' (DB 51/T1480—2012) and 'The Calculation of Reasonable Livestock Carrying Capacity for Natural Grasslands' (NY/T 635—2015). This results in the estimation of the reasonable livestock carrying capacity in sheep units (MU/km2) over a temporal span from 2000 to 2019, with a spatial resolution of 250 meters.

Enablement.Question: What advancements in satellite imaging and data processing techniques have enabled the estimation of reasonable livestock carrying capacity on grasslands with high spatial resolution?
Enablement.Answer: The estimation of reasonable livestock carrying capacity on grasslands with high spatial resolution is enabled by the use of MODIS satellite data for retrieving edible grass yield (fresh weight, kg/hm2). This data is processed in accordance with established standards like 'DB 51/T1480—2012' and 'NY/T 635—2015' to evaluate reasonable carrying capacity (sheep units, MU/km2) over a time series from 2000 to 2019, with a spatial resolution of 250 meters.
